title: Authors and Citation
text: Lyu W, Xiao J, Zhu R, Xu G, Wang C (2024). VEMIRT: Variational Expectation Maximization High-Dimensional IRT Models. R package version 2.1, https://MAP-LAB-UW.github.io/VEMIRT/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {VEMIRT: Variational Expectation Maximization for High-Dimensional IRT Models},   author = {Weicong Lyu and Jiaying Xiao and Ruoyi Zhu and Gongjun Xu and Chun Wang},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 2.1},   url = {https://MAP-LAB-UW.github.io/VEMIRT/}, }

what: Variational Expectation Maximization for High-Dimensional IRT Models
title: Variational Expectation Maximization for High-Dimensional IRT Models
text: goal VEMIRT provide computationally efficient tools high-dimensional data, large sample sizes, large item banks, complex designs. package contains several example datasets functions Parallel Analysis Exploratory Confirmatory M2PL Analysis Exploratory Confirmatory M3PL Analysis Standard error estimates Confirmatory M2PL Analysis Bootstrap sampling importance sampling correction M2PL Analysis Differential item functioning detection M2PL Analysis

title: Variational Expectation Maximization for High-Dimensional IRT Models
text: install package source: Windows users may need install Rtools include checkbox option installing Rtools path easier command line usage. Mac users download necessary tools Xcode related command line tools (found within Xcode’s Preference Pane Downloads/Components); Linux distributions already date compilers (can updated easily). Install devtools package (necessary), install package GitHub :

what: Bootstrap Version of GVEM Confirmatory Analysis for M2PL — C2PL_bs
title: Bootstrap Version of GVEM Confirmatory Analysis for M2PL — C2PL_bs
text: bootstrap version GVEM (.e., GVEM-BS) can implemented correct bias item parameters compute standard errors confirmatory M2PL models

title: Bootstrap Version of GVEM Confirmatory Analysis for M2PL — C2PL_bs
Bootstrap Version of GVEM Confirmatory Analysis for M2PL — C2PL_bs
text: gvem_result list includes exploratory confirmatory GVEM results M2PL models. boots number bootstrap samples; default 5

title: Bootstrap Version of GVEM Confirmatory Analysis for M2PL — C2PL_bs
text: list containing following objects: boots_a item discrimination parameters corrected bootstrap sampling, \(J \times K\) matrix boots_b item difficulty parameters corrected bootstrap sampling, vector length \(J\) sd_a stardard errors item discrimination parameters, \(J \times K\) matrix sd_b stardard errors item difficulty parameters, vector length \(J\)

title: Bootstrap Version of GVEM Confirmatory Analysis for M2PL — C2PL_bs
text: Jiaying Xiao <jxiao6@uw.edu>

title: Bootstrap Version of GVEM Confirmatory Analysis for M2PL — C2PL_bs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ gvem_result <- with(C2PL_data, C2PL_gvem(data, model)) C2PL_bs(gvem_result, boots=10)} # }

title: Confirmatory M2PL Analysis — C2PL_gvem
Confirmatory M2PL Analysis — C2PL_gvem
text: u \(N \times J\) matrix data.frame consists binary responses \(N\) individuals \(J\) items. missing values coded NA indic \(J \times K\) matrix data.frame describes factor loading structure \(J\) items \(K\) factors. consists binary values 0 refers item irrelevant factor, 1 otherwise max.iter maximum number iterations EM cycle; default 5000 SE.est whether estimate SE item parameters using updated supplemented expectation maximization (USEM); default FALSE

title: Confirmatory M2PL Analysis — C2PL_gvem
text: list containing following objects: ra item discrimination parameters, \(J \times K\) matrix rb item difficulty parameters, vector length \(J\) reta variational parameters \(\eta(\xi)\), \(N \times J\) matrix reps variational parameters \(\xi\), \(N \times J\) matrix rsigma population variance-covariance matrix, \(K \times K\) matrix mu_i mean parameter person, \(K \times N\) matrix sig_i covariance matrix person, \(K \times K \times N\) array n number iterations EM cycle Q_mat factor loading structure, \(J \times K\) matrix GIC model fit index AIC model fit index BIC model fit index SE Standard errors item parameters, \(J \times (K+1)\) matrix last column includes SE estimates item difficulty parameters

title: Importance Weighted Version of GVEM Analysis for M2PL Models — C2PL_iw

title: Importance Weighted Version of GVEM Analysis for M2PL Models — C2PL_iw
code: C2PL_iw(u, gvem_result, S = 10, M = 10, max.iter = 10)  E2PL_iw(u, gvem_result, S = 10, M = 10, max.iter = 10)

title: Importance Weighted Version of GVEM Analysis for M2PL Models — C2PL_iw
text: u \(N \times J\) matrix data.frame consists binary responses \(N\) individuals \(J\) items. missing values coded NA gvem_result list includes exploratory confirmatory GVEM results M2PL models. S number times draw samples;default 10 M number samples drawn variational distributions;default 10 max.iter maximum number iterations EM cycle; default 10

title: Importance Weighted Version of GVEM Analysis for M2PL Models — C2PL_iw
text: list containing following objects: ra item discrimination parameters estimated GVEM, \(J \times K\) matrix rb item difficulty parameters estimated GVEM, vector length \(J\) reta variational parameters \(\eta(\xi)\), \(N \times J\) matrix reps variational parameters \(\xi\), \(N \times J\) matrix rsigma population variance-covariance matrix estimated GVEM, \(K \times K\) matrix mu_i mean parameter person, \(K \times N\) matrix sig_i covariance matrix person, \(K \times K \times N\) array n number iterations EM cycle rk factor loadings, \(J \times K\) matrix, exploratory analysis Q_mat factor loading structure, \(J \times K\) matrix GIC model fit index AIC model fit index BIC model fit index SE Standard errors item parameters, \(J \times (K+1)\) matrix last column includes SE estimates item difficulty parameters, confirmatory analysis ur_a item discrimination parameters conducting rotation, \(J \times K\) matrix, exploratory analysis new_a item discrimination parameters estimated IW-GVEM, \(J \times K\) matrix new_b item difficulty parameters estimated IW-GVEM, vector length \(J\) new_Sigma_theta population variance-covariance matrix estimated IV-GVEM, \(K \times K\) matrix best_lr learning rate used importance sampling best_lb lower bound value importance sampling

title: Importance Weighted Version of GVEM Analysis for M2PL Models — C2PL_iw
text: Jiaying Xiao <jxiao6@uw.edu>

title: Importance Weighted Version of GVEM Analysis for M2PL Models — C2PL_iw
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ CFA_result <- with(C2PL_data, C2PL_gvem(data, model)) C2PL_iw(C2PL_data$data, CFA_result)} # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ EFA_result <- with(E2PL_data_C1, E2PL_gvem_lasso(data, model, constrain = constrain, non_pen = non_pen)) E2PL_iw(E2PL_data_C1$data, EFA_result)} # }

title: Stochastic GVEM for Confirmatory M3PL Analysis — C3PL_sgvem
code: C3PL_sgvem(   u,   indic,   samp = 50,   forgetrate = 0.51,   mu_b,   sigma2_b,   Alpha,   Beta,   max.iter = 5000 )

title: Stochastic GVEM for Confirmatory M3PL Analysis — C3PL_sgvem
text: u \(N \times J\) matrix data.frame consists binary responses \(N\) individuals \(J\) items. missing values coded NA indic \(J \times K\) matrix data.frame describes factor loading structure \(J\) items \(K\) factors. consists binary values 0 refers item irrelevant factor, 1 otherwise samp subsample iteration; default 50 forgetrate forget rate stochastic algorithm. value within range 0.5 1. Default 0.51 mu_b mean parameter prior distribution item difficulty parameters sigma2_b variance parameter prior distribution item difficulty parameters Alpha \(\alpha\) parameter prior distribution guessing parameters Beta \(\beta\) parameter prior distribution guessing parameters max.iter maximum number iterations EM cycle; default 5000

title: Stochastic GVEM for Confirmatory M3PL Analysis — C3PL_sgvem
text: list containing following objects: ra item discrimination parameters, \(J \times K\) matrix rb item difficulty parameters, vector length \(J\) rc item guessing parameters, vector length \(J\) rs variational parameters \(s\), \(N \times J\) matrix reta variational parameters \(\eta(\xi)\), \(N \times J\) matrix reps variational parameters \(\xi\), \(N \times J\) matrix rsigma population variance-covariance matrix, \(K \times K\) matrix mu_i mean parameter person, \(K \times N\) matrix sig_i covariance matrix person, \(K \times K \times N\) array n number iterations EM cycle Q_mat factor loading structure, \(J \times K\) matrix GIC model fit index AIC model fit index BIC model fit index

title: Stochastic GVEM for Confirmatory M3PL Analysis — C3PL_sgvem
text: Cho, . E., Wang, C., Zhang, X., & Xu, G. (2021). Gaussian variational estimation multidimensional item response theory. British Journal Mathematical Statistical Psychology, 74, 52-85. Cho, . E., Xiao, J., Wang, C., & Xu, G. (2022). Regularized Variational Estimation Exploratory Item Factor Analysis. Psychometrika. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11336-022-09874-6

what: EM Algorithms for DIF Detection in M2PL Models — D2PL_em
title: EM Algorithms for DIF Detection in M2PL Models — D2PL_em
text: EM Algorithms DIF Detection M2PL Models

title: EM Algorithms for DIF Detection in M2PL Models — D2PL_em
code: D2PL_em(   data,   model = matrix(1, ncol(data)),   group = rep(1, nrow(data)),   method = "EMM",   Lambda0 = if (length(unique(group)) == 1) 0 else seq(0.2, 0.8, by = 0.1),   level = 10,   criterion = "BIC",   iter = 200,   eps = 0.001,   c = 1 )

title: EM Algorithms for DIF Detection in M2PL Models — D2PL_em
text: data \(N\times J\) binary matrix item responses (missing responses coded NA) model \(J\times K\) binary matrix loading indicators  (items load dimension default) group \(N\) dimensional vector group indicators 1 G (respondents group default) method Estimation algorithm, one 'EM' 'EMM' Lambda0 vector lambda0 values \(L_1\) penalty (lambda equals sqrt(N) * lambda0) level Accuracy level, either number mvQuad vector indicating grid latent dimension criterion Information criterion model selection, one 'BIC' (recommended), 'AIC', 'GIC' iter Maximum number iterations eps Termination criterion numerical accuracy c Constant computing GIC

title: EM Algorithms for DIF Detection in M2PL Models — D2PL_em
text: object class vemirt_DIF, list containing following elements: N Number respondents niter0 Number(s) iterations initialization fit best (lowest information criterion) model, element best index fit list models length Lambda0: ...$lambda0 Corresponding element Lambda0 ...$lambda sqrt(N) * lambda0 ...$niter Number(s) iterations ...$Sigma Group-level posterior covariance matrices ...$Mu Group-level posterior mean vectors ...$Slopes group 1 ...$b Intercepts group 1 ...$gamma D2PL parameters slopes ...$beta D2PL parameters intercepts ...$ll Log-likelihood ...$l0 Number nonzero D2PL parameters gamma beta ...$AIC Akaike Information Criterion: -2*ll+l0*2 ...$BIC Bayesian Information Criterion: -2*ll+l0*log(N) ...$GIC Generalized Information Criterion: -2*ll+c*l0*log(N)*log(log(N))

title: EM Algorithms for DIF Detection in M2PL Models — D2PL_em
text: Weicong Lyu <wlyu4@uw.edu>

text: GVEM Algorithms DIF Detection M2PL Models

title: GVEM Algorithms for DIF Detection in M2PL Models — D2PL_gvem
code: D2PL_gvem(   data,   model = matrix(1, ncol(data)),   group = rep(1, nrow(data)),   method = "IWGVEMM",   Lambda0 = if (length(unique(group)) == 1) 0 else seq(0.2, 0.8, by = 0.1),   criterion = "GIC",   iter = 200,   eps = 0.001,   c = 1,   S = 10,   M = 10,   lr = 0.1 )

title: GVEM Algorithms for DIF Detection in M2PL Models — D2PL_gvem
text: data \(N\times J\) binary matrix item responses (missing responses coded NA) model \(J\times K\) binary matrix loading indicators  (items load dimension default) group \(N\) dimensional vector group indicators 1 G (respondents group default) method Estimation algorithm, one 'GVEM' 'IWGVEMM' Lambda0 vector lambda0 values \(L_1\) penalty (lambda equals sqrt(N) * lambda0) criterion Information criterion model selection, one 'GIC' (recommended), 'BIC', 'AIC' iter Maximum number iterations eps Termination criterion numerical accuracy c Constant computing GIC S Sample size approximating expected lower bound ('IWGVEMM' ) M Sample size approximating tighter lower bound ('IWGVEMM' ) lr Learning rate Adam optimizer ('IWGVEMM' )

title: GVEM Algorithms for DIF Detection in M2PL Models — D2PL_gvem
text: object class vemirt_DIF, list containing following elements: N Number respondents niter0 Number(s) iterations initialization fit best (lowest information criterion) model, element best index fit list models length Lambda0: ...$lambda0 Corresponding element Lambda0 ...$lambda sqrt(N) * lambda0 ...$niter Number(s) iterations ...$SIGMA Person-level posterior covariance matrices ...$MU Person-level posterior mean vectors ...$Sigma Group-level posterior covariance matrices ...$Mu Group-level posterior mean vectors ...$Slopes group 1 ...$b Intercepts group 1 ...$gamma D2PL parameters slopes ...$beta D2PL parameters intercepts ...$RMSE Root mean square error fitted probability item group ...$ll Estimated lower bound log-likelihood ...$l0 Number nonzero D2PL parameters gamma beta ...$AIC Akaike Information Criterion: -2*ll+l0*2 ...$BIC Bayesian Information Criterion: -2*ll+l0*log(N) ...$GIC Generalized Information Criterion: -2*ll+c*l0*log(N)*log(log(N))

what: Exploratory M2PL Analysis with Adaptive Lasso Penalty — E2PL_gvem_adaptlasso
title: Exploratory M2PL Analysis with Adaptive Lasso Penalty — E2PL_gvem_adaptlasso
text: Exploratory M2PL Analysis Adaptive Lasso Penalty

title: Exploratory M2PL Analysis with Adaptive Lasso Penalty — E2PL_gvem_adaptlasso
code: E2PL_gvem_adaptlasso(   u,   indic,   max.iter = 5000,   constrain = "C1",   non_pen = NULL,   gamma = 2 )

title: Exploratory M2PL Analysis with Adaptive Lasso Penalty — E2PL_gvem_adaptlasso
text: u \(N \times J\) matrix data.frame consists binary responses \(N\) individuals \(J\) items. missing values coded NA indic \(J \times K\) matrix data.frame describes factor loading structure \(J\) items \(K\) factors. consists binary values 0 refers item irrelevant factor, 1 otherwise. exploratory factor analysis adaptive lasso penalty, indic include constraints \(K \times K\) sub-matrix ensure identifiability. remaining parts assume pre-specified zero structure instead, appropriate lasso penalty recover true zero structure. Also see constrain max.iter maximum number iterations EM cycle; default 5000 constrain constraint setting: "C1" "C2". ensure identifiability, "C1" sets \(K \times K\) sub-matrix indic identity matrix.constraint anchor \(K\) factors designating \(K\) items load solely factor respectively. Note \(K \times K\) matrix appear top indic matrix. "C2" sets \(K \times K\) sub-matrix lower triangular matrix diagonal ones. , test items associated factor sure may associated factors well. Nonzero entries (lower triangular part) except diagonal entries sub-matrix penalized estimation procedure. instance, assume \(K=3\), "C2" constraint imply following submatrix: \(C2=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0\\ 1 & 1 & 0\\ 1 & 1 & 1\\\end{bmatrix}\). shown, item 1 allowed load first factor, item 2 sure load second factor may also load first factor (hence penalty added \((2,1)\) element "C2", .e., \(C2_{2,1}\) ). Item 3 sure load third factor may also load first two factors. However, note remaining items loading vector \((1, 1, 1)\) hence indistinguishable third anchor item. Therefore, need alert algorithm third anchor item sure load third factor, whether loads first two factors depends regularization results. Therefore, need specify "non_pen=" identify \(K\)th anchor item. Although, "C2" much weaker "C1", still ensures empirical identifiability. Default "C1". estimation, "C1" "C2" constraints, population means variances constrained 0 1, respectively. non_pen index item associated every factor constraint "C2". C1, input can NULL gamma numerical value adaptive lasso parameter. Zou (2006) recommended three values, 0.5, 1, 2. default value 2.

title: Exploratory M2PL Analysis with Adaptive Lasso Penalty — E2PL_gvem_adaptlasso
text: list containing following objects: ra item discrimination parameters, \(J \times K\) matrix rb item difficulty parameters, vector length \(J\) reta variational parameters \(\eta(\xi)\), \(N \times J\) matrix reps variational parameters \(\xi\), \(N \times J\) matrix rsigma population variance-covariance matrix, \(K \times K\) matrix mu_i mean parameter person, \(K \times N\) matrix sig_i covariance matrix person, \(K \times K \times N\) array n number iterations EM cycle Q_mat factor loading structure, \(J \times K\) matrix GIC model fit index AIC model fit index BIC model fit index lbd numerical value lasso penalty parameter \(\lambda\)

title: Exploratory M2PL Analysis with Adaptive Lasso Penalty — E2PL_gvem_adaptlasso
text: Cho, . E., Xiao, J., Wang, C., & Xu, G. (2022). Regularized Variational Estimation Exploratory Item Factor Analysis. Psychometrika. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11336-022-09874-6 Zou, H. (2006). adaptive LASSO oracle properties.  Journal American Statistical Association, 7, 1011418–1429.

title: Exploratory M2PL Analysis with Lasso Penalty — E2PL_gvem_lasso
text: u \(N \times J\) matrix data.frame consists binary responses \(N\) individuals \(J\) items. missing values coded NA indic \(J \times K\) matrix data.frame describes factor loading structure \(J\) items \(K\) factors. consists binary values 0 refers item irrelevant factor, 1 otherwise. exploratory factor analysis lasso penalty, indic imposed certain constraints \(K \times K\) sub-matrix ensure identifiability. remaining parts assume pre-specified zero structure instead, appropriate lasso penalty recover true zero structure. Also see constrain max.iter maximum number iterations EM cycle; default 5000 constrain constraint setting: "C1" "C2". ensure identifiablity, "C1" sets \(K \times K\) sub-matrix indic identity matrix.constraint anchor \(K\) factors designating \(K\) items load solely factor respectively. Note \(K \times K\) matrix appear top indic matrix. "C2" sets \(K \times K\) sub-matrix lower triangular matrix diagonal ones. , test items associated factor sure may associated factors well. Nonzero entries (lower triangular part) except diagonal entries sub-matrix penalized estimation procedure. instance, assume \(K=3\), "C2" constraint imply following submatrix: \(C2=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0\\ 1 & 1 & 0\\ 1 & 1 & 1\\\end{bmatrix}\). shown, item 1 allowed load first factor, item 2 sure load second factor may also load first factor (hence penalty added \((2,1)\) element "C2", .e., \(C2_{2,1}\) ). Item 3 sure load third factor may also load first two factors. However, note remaining items loading vector \((1, 1, 1)\) hence indistinguishable third anchor item. Therefore, need alert algorithm third anchor item sure load third factor, whether loads first two factors depends regularization results. Therefore, need specify "non_pen=" identify \(K\)th anchor item. Although, "C2" much weaker "C1", still ensures empirical identifiability. Default "C1". estimation, "C1" "C2" constraints, population means variances constrained 0 1, respectively. non_pen index item associated every factor constraint "C2". C1, input can NULL

title: Stochastic GVEM with Adaptive Lasso Penalty for Exploratory M3PL Analysis — E3PL_sgvem_adaptlasso
code: E3PL_sgvem_adaptlasso(   u,   indic,   samp = 50,   forgetrate = 0.51,   mu_b,   sigma2_b,   Alpha,   Beta,   max.iter = 5000,   constrain = "C1",   non_pen = NULL,   gamma = 2 )

title: Stochastic GVEM with Adaptive Lasso Penalty for Exploratory M3PL Analysis — E3PL_sgvem_adaptlasso
text: u \(N \times J\) matrix data.frame consists binary responses \(N\) individuals \(J\) items. missing values coded NA indic \(J \times K\) matrix data.frame describes factor loading structure \(J\) items \(K\) factors. consists binary values 0 refers item irrelevant factor, 1 otherwise. exploratory factor analysis lasso penalty, indic imposed certain constraints \(K \times K\) sub-matrix ensure identifiability. remaining parts assume pre-specified zero structure instead, appropriate lasso penalty recover true zero structure. Also see constrain samp subsample iteration; default 50 forgetrate forget rate stochastic algorithm. value within range 0.5 1. Default 0.51 mu_b mean parameter normal prior distribution item difficulty parameters sigma2_b variance parameter normal prior distribution item difficulty parameters Alpha \(\alpha\) parameter beta prior distribution guessing parameters Beta \(\beta\) parameter beta prior distribution guessing parameters max.iter maximum number iterations EM cycle; default 5000 constrain constraint setting: "C1" "C2". ensure identifiablity, "C1" sets \(K \times K\) sub-matrix indic identity matrix.constraint anchor \(K\) factors designating \(K\) items load solely factor respectively. Note \(K \times K\) matrix appear top indic matrix. "C2" sets \(K \times K\) sub-matrix lower triangular matrix diagonal ones. , test items associated factor sure may associated factors well. Nonzero entries (lower triangular part) except diagonal entries sub-matrix penalized estimation procedure. instance, assume \(K=3\), "C2" constraint imply following submatrix: \(C2=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0\\ 1 & 1 & 0\\ 1 & 1 & 1\\\end{bmatrix}\). shown, item 1 allowed load first factor, item 2 sure load second factor may also load first factor (hence penalty added \((2,1)\) element "C2", .e., \(C2_{2,1}\) ). Item 3 sure load third factor may also load first two factors. However, note remaining items loading vector \((1, 1, 1)\) hence indistinguishable third anchor item. Therefore, need alert algorithm third anchor item sure load third factor, whether loads first two factors depends regularization results. Therefore, need specify "non_pen=" identify \(K\)th anchor item. Although, "C2" much weaker "C1", still ensures empirical identifiability. Default "C1". estimation, "C1" "C2" constraints, population means variances constrained 0 1, respectively. non_pen index item associated factor satisfy "C2". C1, input can NULL gamma numerical value adaptive lasso parameter. Zou (2006) recommended three values, 0.5, 1, 2. default value 2.

title: Stochastic GVEM with Adaptive Lasso Penalty for Exploratory M3PL Analysis — E3PL_sgvem_adaptlasso

title: Stochastic GVEM for Exploratory M3PL Analysis — E3PL_sgvem_rot
text: u \(N \times J\) matrix data.frame consists binary responses \(N\) individuals \(J\) items. missing values coded NA domain number factors samp subsample iteration; default 50 forgetrate forget rate stochastic algorithm. value within range 0.5 1. Default 0.51 mu_b mean parameter prior distribution item difficulty parameters sigma2_b variance parameter prior distribution item difficulty parameters Alpha \(\alpha\) parameter prior distribution guessing parameters Beta \(\beta\) parameter prior distribution guessing parameters max.iter maximum number iterations EM cycle; default 5000 rot post-hoc rotation method: Promax CF-Quartimax; default "Promax", may also "cfQ" conducting CF-Quartimax rotation

what: VEMIRT: A package for high-dimensional IRT models — VEMIRT-package
title: VEMIRT: A package for high-dimensional IRT models — VEMIRT-package
text: VEMIRT created assist researchers conduct exploratory confirmatory multidimensional item response theory (MIRT) analysis cooresponding item differential functioning (DIF) analysis. core computation engine VEMIRT family Gaussian Variational EM algorithms considerably efficient currently available algorithms software packages, especially number latent factors exceeds four.

title: VEMIRT: A package for high-dimensional IRT models — VEMIRT-package
text: pa_poly identifies number factors via parallel analysis.

title: VEMIRT: A package for high-dimensional IRT models — VEMIRT-package
text: E2PL_gvem_rot conducts M2PL Analysis post-hoc rotation (Promax & CF-Quartimax) E2PL_gvem_lasso conducts M2PL Analysis Lasso penalty E2PL_gvem_adaptlasso conducts M2PL Analysis adaptive Lasso penalty E2PL_iw conducts importance sampling correct bias M2PL analysis E3PL_sgvem_rot conducts stochastic GVEM futher imporve computational effficiency exploratory M3PL analysis E3PL_sgvem_lasso conducts M3PL Analysis Lasso penalty E3PL_sgvem_adaptlasso conducts M3PL Analysis adaptive Lasso penalty

title: VEMIRT: A package for high-dimensional IRT models — VEMIRT-package
text: C2PL_gvem conducts GVEM confirmatory M2PL analysis C2PL_bs conducts bootstrap sampling correct bias produce standard errors confirmatory M2PL analysis C2PL_iw conducts importance sampling correct bias M2PL analysis C3PL_sgvem conducts stochastic GVEM confirmatory M3PL analysis

title: VEMIRT: A package for high-dimensional IRT models — VEMIRT-package
text: D2PL_em conducts DIF analysis M2PL models using EM algorithms D2PL_gvem conducts DIF analysis M2PL models using GVEM algorithms D2PL_lrt conducts DIF analysis M2PL models using likelihood ratio test

title: VEMIRT: A package for high-dimensional IRT models — VEMIRT-package
text: Maintainer: Weicong Lyu wlyu4@uw.edu (ORCID) Authors: Jiaying Xiao jxiao6@uw.edu (ORCID) Ruoyi Zhu zhux0445@uw.edu (ORCID) Gongjun Xu gongjun@umich.edu (ORCID) Chun Wang wang4066@uw.edu (ORCID)
